</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Send the variable value to the server - same limitations regarding variable type as [[publicVariable#Description|publicVariable]]. <br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature arma3</title><part><name index="1"/><value>In Arma 3 it is possible to broadcast [[nil]] value</value></part></template></value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>  

____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''publicVariableServer''' varName </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> varName: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>'''publicVariableServer''' "CTFscoreOne";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[publicVariable]], [[publicVariableClient]], [[addPublicVariableEventHandler]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on 24 Aug, 2012
<dt class="note">[[User:Kylania|Kylania]]<dd class="note">
[[publicVariableServer]] (run on client)<BR>
[[publicVariableClient]] (run on server)<BR>

Publishers the variable (name as STRING) to the server only. Useful when you want to synchronize a variable with the server but not any other clients. - [http://forums.bistudio.com/showthread.php?136494-ARMA-2-OA-beta-build-94209-(1-60-MP-compatible-build-post-1-60-release)&p=2179795&viewfull=1#post2179795 Rocket]

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
